data.meta_description: In Pennsylvania, UGI Corporation runs this Taurus 60 gas turbine to help produce over 120,000 gallons of Liquified Natural Gas (LNG) per day. These LNG plantsâ€¦ | 16 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
Our most recent look at global LNG takes a look at the crucial roles of China and Russia in driving demand. Our report indicates that natural gas fundamentals in these two areas alone will play a significant role in shaping the future of liquid natural gas (LNG) over the next eight years, and LNG will contribute to approximately 65% of global gas demand growth by 2030. Notably, the report's base case suggests no significant global LNG overbuild until 2030, with around 16 Bcf/d of additional LNG projects expected to come online in North America by that time. https://lnkd.in/e5-zExyN

What does Summer 2024 hold for North American gas and #LNG? In a recent webinar, our experts provided an in-depth view on low gas prices, production deferrals, increased Mexican imports and the recent flipping of the power market import/export dynamic between the US and Canada. in our latest insight, discover our highlights from our #gas webinar: https://okt.to/PEvuLC

Good morning: Attached, on page 44, is an article New Energy Development Company LLC (NEDC) wrote for the LNG Industry Magazine January 2024 addition. It highlights NEDC long term view of Natural gas, LNG and H2 along with an NEDC patent pending system for cryogenic storage. First, The US uses approximately 100 Quadrillion BTU/year of energy. Natural Gas and LNG are critical components to bridge the gap to a carbon neutral future. H2 energy markets are slow to develop in the US and E-methane and LNG provide a bridge as well. In this article, NEDC presents a Patent Pending system: Full containment, Double SS walls with no bottom penetrations and no internal pumps needed. This is a significant innovation in cryogenic storage and the first major innovation in cryogenic technology in a long time. https://lnkd.in/eUp2mwDU As always, I look forward to your questions and thoughts. Tom - 978 208 1586 tquine@newenergydev.com www.newenergydev.com
